title: Notation for nonempty intersection
snippet: There is no standard mathematical symbol for the intersection relation. You've probably encountered the symbol for the intersection *operation*. If A and B are sets, then "the intersection" of A and B, denoted A \cap B, is the set of all x such that x \in A and x \in B. It's the middle part of a Venn diagram. That's fine, but I'm talking about the intersection *relation*. We say that A "intersects" B if there exists some x such that x \in A and x \in B.
